title: Little improvement to MCAS scores as districts work to reach prepandemic achievement
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News English language arts scores for both third through eighth graders and 10th graders were 10 points behind 2019's scores.
Elementary and Secondary Education Commissioner Pedro Martinez who visited eighth grade classroom Ottoson Middle School in Arlington on Sept.

title: 3 takeaways from Bruins’ shootout preseason loss to Flyers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "When I feel like I did today, I know I can do a lot of things.
" The Flyers' Bobby Brink beats Bruins goalie Jeremy Swayman for the winning goal in the shootout.
Ken McGagh for The Boston Globe By Conor Ryan September 29, 2025 5 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: 5 keys for Red Sox if they want to eliminate Yankees in Wild Card round
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox The Red Sox' pitching corps will have their hands full with a Yankees lineup that slugged a league-leading 274 home runs this season.
Garrett Crochet will be tasked with putting Boston ahead early as Tuesday's Game 1 starter.
AP Photo/Jim Davis By Conor Ryan September 29, 2025 5 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: ICE used autistic 5-year-old to ‘lure’ Leominster father, family’s lawyer says
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News “They had his address, and they had his attorney's name.
They had all the information they needed to do this in a different manner," his lawyer said.
The 5-year-old girl stands for a portrait with her mother and sisters after federal agents detained their father, Edwards Hip.

title: ‘Kill the liberals’: Watertown resident reports flyers with violent message
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The Watertown resident, who had a political sign in their yard, told police they found a handwritten page in sharpie that said “Save America, kill the liberals.
” A demonstrator holds a sign during a "No Kings" protest, Saturday, June 14, 2025, in Atlanta.
AP Photo/Mike Stewart Officials are investigating after a Watertown resident found flyers near their home earlier this month calling to “kill the liberals,” police said.

title: 8 takeaways from Celtics Media Day
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics "If I ever get to the point where I start basing my motivations on the expectations of others and people I've never met before, I'll retire and quit.
" Joe Mazzulla and the rest of the Celtics addressed the media on Monday at the Auerbach Center.
Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe By Conor Ryan September 29, 2025 8 minutes to read After a transformative summer, the 2025-26 Celtics are set to begin a new season.

title: Bill Nye drops by the Auerbach Center and asks Jaylen Brown a question at Celtics Media Day
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Boston Celtics "I feel like it's Celtic history being able to have Bill Nye in the Auerbach center.
That's pretty cool.

" Bill Nye Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe Bill Nye, the Emmy-winning science educator who received the Presidential Medal of Freedom and a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame this year, came to Brighton to pay Celtics star Jaylen Brown a visit on Monday.

title: Police release images of 8 people sought in alleged attack on gay couple in Mattapan
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The gay couple was allegedly targeted with homophobic language before a fight on River Street in Mattapan, police said earlier this month.

Boston Police Department By Molly Farrar September 29, 2025 | 5:32 PM 1 minute to read Boston police are asking for the public’s help identifying a group of men associated with an attack on a gay couple in Mattapan earlier this month.

The gay couple was allegedly targeted with homophobic language before a fight on River Street where one of the men from the couple was hit in the back of the head with a baseball bat during a fight, police previously said.

title: Joe Mazzulla wants to nip this Payton Pritchard narrative in the bud ‘immediately’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Boston Celtics "I see what you did there, trying to build that correlation between Payton and Anfernee, which I'm sure you'll try to do the whole season.
" Payton Pritchard attempts to drive past Anfernee Simons.

Erin Clark/The Boston Globe Within the same breath, a reporter asked Celtics coach Joe Mazzulla on Monday what his expectations are for Payton Pritchard this season and how well he had gotten to know newcomer Anfernee Simons.

title: Watch Charlie Day play ‘Dayman’ at Boston piano bar
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Restaurants The "It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia" actor spent several days in Boston promoting Four Walls Whiskey.
Charlie Day played piano at the 88 Club, one of his stops in Boston to promote Four Walls Whiskey.

Courtesy of 88 Club It’s no Paddy’s Pub, but for 20 minutes on Saturday night, the patrons of The 88 Club piano bar in Back Bay cheered on the whiskey-pouring and piano-playing skills of actor Charlie Day, famously from longtime FX show It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia.
